intro: Castalia odorata, commonly known as the sweet shrub or sweet pepper shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round, orange or red berries that are edible and have a sweet, citrusy flavor. Castalia odorata thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and culinary uses. Its leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
